ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I feel frustrated about my hair pulling.
I get nervous being near to others, being in the front row, or being in bright light, rain, or wind.
Hairpulling really interferes with my life.
I worry that someone will ask me about my hair loss.
I feel unattractive because of my pulling.
There are times when pulling really gets me down.
I feel embarrassed or ashamed about hair pulling.
I think my hair loss is noticeable to others.
I feel helpless to stop pulling my hair.
Because of my pulling, I feel isolated and alone.
I feel guilty for the trouble my pulling has caused.
I believe that even if I try hard not to pull, I'll just start pulling again.
There are things I have not been able to do because of pulling (e.g. swimming, sports, going to hairdresser).
I think people probably think I'm crazy because I pull my hair out.
I am less productive at work, school, or home because of the time I spend pulling or covering up my hair loss.
I check to make sure my hair loss is hidden.
I avoid going to doctors because of my hair loss (e.g. physician, optometrist, dentist, obstetrician/gynecologist).
I feel like no one understands me.
Because of my hair pulling I avoid social events (e.g. dating, parties, meetings).
I feel scared others would reject me if they knew about my pulling.
If I accidentally pull one hair I can catch myself and stop.
I feel that there is no one I can talk to about my hair pulling.
Because of my pulling, I get nervous when I meet someone new.
I am able to resist the urge to pull.
I feel weird or strange because I pull my hair.
I use effective strategies to help me limit my pulling.
I think I am making progress in dealing with my hair pulling.
